creator: DisasterAWARE (Automated)
hazard_Name: Flood - Boston, MA--NH--RI Region, United States
description:
The National Weather Service (NWS) has issued a Flood Warning on July 14, 2020, 20:56:00 GMT for Boston, MA--NH--RI Region, United States.

A Flood Warning is issued when flooding is imminent or occurring.

It is estimated that 48,197 people, 18,537 households, and $7.18 Billion (USD) of infrastructure* are within the flood warning areas. 
*The cost represents the total replacement value of the infrastructure.

More Information:
The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Southwestern Rockingham County in southern New Hampshire...

* Until 800 PM EDT.

* At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or
expected to begin shortly. Rainfall rates of 1 to 3 inches an hour
are expected.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Doppler radar.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include...
Derry, Exeter, Epping, Brentwood, Raymond, Hampstead, Kingston,
Auburn, Chester, and Danville.
